atDirectives.name: @tailwind
atDirectives.description: Use the `@tailwind` directive to insert Tailwind's `base`, `components`, `utilities` and `variants` styles into your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use the `@apply` directive to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS.

atDirectives.name: @layer
atDirectives.description: Use the `@layer` directive to tell Tailwind which "bucket" a set of custom styles belong to. Valid layers are `base`, `components`, and `utilities`.

atDirectives.name: @theme
atDirectives.description: Use the `@theme` directive in Tailwind CSS v4 to define design tokens like colors, fonts, and spacing that become available as utility classes.

atDirectives.name: @config
atDirectives.description: Use the `@config` directive to specify which config file Tailwind should use when compiling that CSS file.

atDirectives.name: @import
atDirectives.description: Use the `@import` directive to import Tailwind CSS or other CSS files.
